title: Why is the term 'research' used instead of scientific investigation? - Quora

response.answer_text: 'Research' in a wide sense presents identification of the problem (raise a question), gathering sufficient amount of data/information, analyzing and interpreting data, presentation and conclusion, finally future scope. 'Research' could be done in science, arts, humanities etc. "Scientific investigation" is a small part of the entire 'research' process, in a particular field, 'science '. Moreover, the word 'investigation' does not include all scopes except data acquisition and analysis. There is none other than 'research', describing this entire process of research seamlessly!
Because there is marketing research, market or economic research, business research, literature research, and so on.
